DOC.brief_summary: Multicenter study allow include first sixty patient implant custom-made corpectomy implant ( UNiD 3D VBR ) : 30 patient implant cervical region 30 patient implanted thoracolumbar region . The main objective confirm feasibilty safety patient-specific implant one multi-level corpectomy fusion . This study approve March 2016 allow include retrospectivley patient since first implantation January 2015 prospectively patient approval .
DOC.detailed_description: Anterior cervical corpectomy fusion ( ACCF ) demonstrate good alternative anterior cervical discectomy fusion ( ACDF ) treat cervical spondylotic myelopathy ( CSM ) . However , use vertebral body replacement ( VBR ) cage technically demanding , especially adjust size cage defect without compromise endplate integrity increase risk subsidence . Beside recent study advocate interest shape , size design implant achieve fusion stability cervical spinal disease indication , 3D printing offering rapid patient-specific manufacturing emerge past year . Several material technology use clinical radiological data still sparse .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients underwent single multilevel cervical thoracolumbar coprectomy implant patient specific implant ( UNiD 3D VBR ) follow indication : Cervical region Fracture / Trauma Tumors Cervical spondylotic myelopathy Infection ( Ex : Osteomyelitis ) Spinal instability Symptomatic degenerative spinal disease Inflammatory rheumatism . Pseudarthrosis Thoracolumbar region Fracture / Trauma Tumors Infection ( Ex : Osteomyelitis ) Spinal instability Symptomatic degenerative spinal disease Pseudarthrosis 2 . Patients > 18 year 3 . Patients sign Informed Consent Form 1 . Patients ca n't n't want sign ICF 2 . Patients unable fill HRQOL questionnaires 3 . Noncompliant paitents regard followup protocol 4 . Pregnant patient intend pregnant within next 2 year 5 . Sytemic local infection 6 . Allergy know suspect componant 7 . Patients present contraindication indicate instruction use
